Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a step towards tyranny and suppression of free speech.
The government is perceived as overreaching by controlling what can be said or thought.
The legislation exempts foreign media companies and the government itself, which is seen as hypocritical.
Existing laws already protect against hate speech and threats, making the new legislation unnecessary.
The author believes in more debate rather than censorship to address misinformation.
Notable Quotes: Government power must really be tenuous if the only way it can hold onto it is by suppressing any and all debate.
The answer to scientific or political controversies isn’t more censorship – it’s more debate.
